title: Swinging Arm - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Raise the rear of the motorcycle and support under the frame and engine.
Support the swinging arm to allow for removal of the rear wheel and rear suspension unit.
Remove the fixings and the upper and lower chain guards.
Support the swinging arm and remove the drop link to swinging arm lock nut and bolt. Discard the lock nut.
Detach the chain from the output sprocket.
Do not allow the caliper to hang on the brake hose as this may damage the hose and could lead to an accident.
Release the brake hose clips from the swinging arm and tie the rear brake caliper to one side.
Remove the fixings and the finisher plates from both sides of the frame.
Remove the swinging arm spindle nut. Discard the nut.
Withdraw the swinging arm spindle from the right hand side and remove the swinging arm. Pass the swinging arm through the drive chain.
Support the drive chain while the swinging arm is being removed to protect it from contamination.
